channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: After the Leadbetters reach the end of their tether with the Goods' crack-of-dawn activities, Tom and Barbara search for new ways to design their schedule.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Yes Minister
channel.desc: Jim Hacker is upset by rumours of a cabinet reshuffle and decides to take drastic action to keep his post.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Miss Marple
channel.desc: A City financier is found dead, having been poisoned, and when Miss Marple hears the news, she is sure she knows why.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Miss Marple
channel.desc: Following another murder, Miss Marple is certain that she knows who the next victim will be. Can she get to them in time.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Agatha Christie
channel.desc: Lucy unpicks Agatha's mysterious 1926 disappearance, examining how it affected her work.

channel.desc: Programmes start at 7.00pm.

channel.title: Helen Mirren Remembers... The Little Minister
channel.desc: Dame Helen Mirren looks back on one of her earliest television roles in the BBC's 1975 adaptation of JM Barrie's The Little Minister.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Little Minister
channel.desc: Ian Ogilvy and Helen Mirren star in this adaptation of JM Barrie's play, set in rural 1840s Scotland. A local priest falls in love with a Gypsy girl who incites a Luddite riot.

channel.title: The Remarkable Journey of Bernard Levin
channel.desc: A look at the life and career of Bernard Levin, who grew up in the poor backstreets of Camden Town and became one of the most famous journalists of the 20th century.

channel.title: A Summer Journey with Angela Rippon
channel.desc: Angela Rippon arrives at Bradford-on-Avon, where, once a year, canal boats take part in a colourful parade.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Walk the Line with Barra Best
channel.desc: Barra Best explores some of Northern Ireland's lost railways. Here, he travels through some spectacular countryside as he explores County Antrim's lost railway routes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Singapore 1942
channel.desc: The story of the fall of Singapore in 1942. The second part shows how General Yamashita drove back Commonwealth forces and assembled his troops to take control of Singapore Island.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Kamikaze
channel.desc: Japanese and US veterans reflect on the 'kamikaze' attacks of World War II, which killed thousands of Japanese airmen and Allied military personnel.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Colouring Light
channel.desc: Profile of painter Brian Clarke, one of the world's greatest stained glass artists. Contains some strong language.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Art on the BBC
channel.desc: Art historian David Dibosa explores the BBC archives to create a television history of one of art's greatest showmen, Salvador Dali.
